DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Information Source Type Code OMOP CDM Device Type Concept Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Executed and carried through to completion._A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it._An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication._Where something is available or from where it originates._A coded value specifying an identifiable class of an entity or activity based on common qualities._A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of Device Exposure recorded. It indicates how the Device Exposure was represented in the source data.

This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Executed and carried through to completion._A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it._An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication._Where something is available or from where it originates._A coded value specifying an identifiable class of an entity or activity based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.:Where something is available or from where it originates.:A coded value specifying an identifiable class of an entity or activity based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.
Where something is available or from where it originates.
A coded value specifying an identifiable class of an entity or activity based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created manually based on BRIDG 5.1 for CDM 8.28.18 mc

ValueDomain.preferredName: OMOP CDM Device Type Concept Identifier
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of Device Exposure recorded. It indicates how the Device Exposure was represented in the source data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.origin: OMOP CDM:The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) Common Data Model

DataElement.origin: OMOP CDM:The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) Common Data Model
DataElement.changeDescription: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.0.2 and OMOP value set for CDM.
